1.text: Inspect the general condition of your dog's ears.

2.text: Look for parasites and foreign bodies in the ear.

3.text: Inspect the ears for any signs of a yeast infection.

4.text: Look for the signs of a bacterial infection in the outer part of the ear.

5.text: Purchase a commercial dog ear cleaner or make you own with common household products.

6.text: Dip a cotton ball into the liquid.

7.text: Gently swab the inside of your dog's ear flap.

8.text: Irrigate your dog's ears fully only if it's recommended to do so by a veterinarian.

9.text: Let your dog clear out its ears after cleaning.
